medical_history.chief_complaint: Mass in the right side of the neck and lump in the throat when swallowing.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2.5 months before presentation. The patient noted a mass in her neck, accompanied by a sensation of a lump in her throat while swallowing. She experienced occasional palpitations and had a mild cough productive of yellow phlegm, attributed to a recent upper respiratory infection. There were no aggravating or relieving factors mentioned.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of myxomatous mitral valve with regurgitation, cardiac arrhythmias, ovarian cysts, anxiety, total hysterectomy, and right salpingo-oophorectomy for uterine fibroids.
medical_history.family_history: Father had hypothyroidism, an aunt had a goiter, and a sister had an unspecified thyroid problem.
medical_history.social_history: Drank alcohol in moderation, did not smoke or use illicit drugs, was married, had no children, and worked in an office.
